website_summaries.verdict: Great value in a dry cat food. Works well for cats with sensitive stomachs.
pros: Four different versions, including for indoor cats and hairball control
Even picky eaters like the taste of this food
Customers notice a good change in cat's excrement after eating this food
cons: Some customers reported receiving a bag with spoiled food
Uses more grains than some other dry foods

customer_reviews.title: My Cats are Much Less Annoying, Thanks to Iams
customer_reviews.text: This cat food is awesome. I have one particular cat that takes liquid dumps when he eats any brand of cat food that I have given him, except for Iams indoor. Occasionaly, I buy cheap cat food at the gas station when I run out and need a temporary fix. All of my cats' problems come back... hair balls, diarrhea, overeating etc. I have no explanation for it, but there is dentinitely something different about this brand, not just clever marketing.
customer_reviews.author: lsmith1018

customer_reviews.title: Recipe changed! Not for the better!
customer_reviews.text: A recipe change occurred with this product mid-2018 from "Chicken" to "Chicken, Turkey, and Garden Greens". Cats did better on the old recipe than anything I've ever fed them. The new recipe has them vomiting all over. Even the dog regretted sneaking a few bites of the cats' new food. Stay away from this new product. Judging by my experience and the mounting number of reviews, it's either inferior to the old product or it's contaminated.
customer_reviews.author: James D.

customer_reviews.title: Finicky cat loves it
customer_reviews.text: I have used this specific cat food for years. My cat is a long haired whie cat, incredibly finicky. The vet suggested it and Isabella will eat it, in fact, it is the ONLY cat food, wet or dry that she condescends to eat. .so yes, I am very pleased with the product.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine j Dean

customer_reviews.title: You will not be receiving the product pictured
customer_reviews.text: You will not be receiving the product pictured. The new formula is Chicken, Turkey and Garden Greens. My two cats have been doing extremely well on the old formula of just chicken. The new formula is much darker, smells different and I would assume taste much different as the cats will barely touch it. I guess I need to look for an alternative.I know IAMS will say they have a 100% money back guarantee but that's not what I want, I want the old formula/recipe back.
customer_reviews.author: Lorenzo S

customer_reviews.title: Finally!!!
customer_reviews.text: As my cat has gotten older, she has been putting me through the test with food. She would stop eating midway through a bag, even the smallest I could buy. She would appear to be "tired" of the taste, and the fool human that I am, I kept changing her out (gradually adjusting to something new). People said, "Leave it there and she'll eat it", but she wouldn't! I noticed a bit of a weight loss and got concerned enough for a vet visit who said she was getting older, not as active, doesn't need so much, but suggested Iams. I just ordered more of this because she finished off the bag. Enough said.
customer_reviews.author: Lonnie

customer_reviews.title: Did the manufacturer change recipe, is this a bad batch? We are concerned.
customer_reviews.text: All three of our casts have gotten sick since we started feeding them this product, and they've been on that same particular formula for years. One has been vomiting almost every time he eats it, and it has been weeks now. Does anyone know if Iams changed this recipe?
customer_reviews.author: Jenny Lombardi

customer_reviews.title: Recipe changed! Not for the better!
customer_reviews.text: A recipe change occurred with this product mid-2018 from "Chicken" to "Chicken, Turkey, and Garden Greens". Cats did better on the old recipe than anything I've ever fed them. The new recipe has them vomiting all over. Even the dog regretted sneaking a few bites of the cats' new food. Stay away from this new product. Judging by my experience and the mounting number of reviews, it's either inferior to the old product or it's contaminated.
customer_reviews.author: James D.

customer_reviews.title: Watch out for mold!
customer_reviews.text: I have this on a monthly auto delivery and this is the second time I’ve gotten part way into a bag (which I pour into an airtight storage container) and discovered clumps of what looks like mold. There were several larger pieces more than the ones in the picture. The first time I though maybe it was a one off and just got rid of it, but this is the second time and now that’s 2 large bags I’ve had to throw away. I’ll be changing brands.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: We have switched foods
customer_reviews.text: I am moving my cat to a catfood that doesn't have meal as a first ingredient. She loves this food, to the point of pestering us all the time for it, but we don't believe she actually is satisfied because she will eat herself to death. When we started switching over to another food, she pestered us way less and she seems contented.
customer_reviews.author: Bridgerish

customer_reviews.title: They eat it. Then they puke. What they don't puke they deposit in the litter box.
customer_reviews.text: I liked that It's cat food. And I like the color of the bag. Wow. It's Soo purty. I don't like.... That our cats eat this then puke all over the place. Kinda seems like a waste of cat food. I think normally when they eat it, it's supposed to come out the other end. Our cats have always eaten iams and not had a problem. Last few months something seems different with this food. *Edit* Had to change my review from two stars to one star. All three of our cats keep puking this up nonstop. Definitely changing to a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: ike

customer_reviews.title: Only IAMS for my Cat
customer_reviews.text: Our 15 pound 3 year old cat is getting too big. I was told to cut back her food substantially. How do you listen to a cat meow because she's hungry? Instead of cutting back the amount I changed to this Weight Control food. She is ever-so-slightly looking like she's using a little weight. I started out with 1/2 regular Iams cat food and 1/2 weight control Iams. She is now around 1/4 regular Iams and 3/4 weight control Iams. Within a month she'll be on Iams Weight Control totally. Highly Recommend IAMS.
customer_reviews.author: Elaine Sagman

customer_reviews.title: Caused vomiting in my three cats.
customer_reviews.text: I have been feeding my pet IAMS for years without any issues. This bag for some reason caused my cat and my girlfriends cats to develop frequent vomiting. I thought at first it was hairball but the frequency was usually after they ate and it was full of kibble. At the advice of my vet I switched to a chicken and fish based protein cat food. Since doing this the cats have been pretty much back to normal and are tolerating the new food better. I don't know why this particular bag caused the cats to vomit so much but it has swayed me from buying IAMS products in the future.
customer_reviews.author: killer dwarf

customer_reviews.title: The other great thing is that this stuff really does decrease hairballs
customer_reviews.text: This stuff really works. I have an eight year old male cat who has been eating this for most of his adult life. Not only does he prefer it over other foods (I've offered several, side by side...) but he's never been overweight. I don't know if that's because of the food or not, but... see below. The other great thing is that this stuff really does decrease hairballs. I know, because whenever I run out and have to use a different kind of food for a week or two, my cat's hairball production goes up considerably. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Moldy
customer_reviews.text: When I opened the bag and an odd smell came from it not really thinking about it fed my cats that day and today when I fed them I found a huge clump of them stuck together with mold.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: "Never Again"... 😿
customer_reviews.text: My Kitty Boy Would Not TOUCH This dry food. 🙀Refused to eat for 2 days & I started seeing "distress": (he stopped eating his wet food AND drinking water). I purchased (2) 16oz. bags that could not be returned. That was too much money wasted, but fortunately we were able to donate it all to a local Kitty Rescue Organization! Upon ordering his favorite food again, his "distresses* disappeared. Happy Healthy Boy again! Happy Mom, too! 💕🌟🥰😽🌟💕
customer_reviews.author: DDEffShopping

customer_reviews.title: Cat and Owner approved
customer_reviews.text: The cat food itself: I have been supplementing my cat's diet with IAMS Proactive Health Indoor cat food for almost 15 years. My cat is a fussy eater but will eat this cat food. (Though she prefers her canned cat food.) I like that helps with her weight and more importantly to me with reducing hairballs. Mars Private US: Provided the correct type of IAMS cat food in a very prompt manner and it arrived in perfect condition.
customer_reviews.author: FJGarner

customer_reviews.title: My Cats Won't Eat This
customer_reviews.text: My cats hate this food, probably because of the size of the kibbles. One of my cats won't even eat it at all. The kibbles are about four times the size of normal dry food. When my cat eats it, she leaves a lot of crumbs in the bottom of the bowl. Since this is Oral Care formula, perhaps this is supposed to happen, but to me, it seems a waste. I certainly won't be purchasing this again.
customer_reviews.author: zCatLady

customer_reviews.title: I was skeptical but this stuff is great
customer_reviews.text: We have three cats, all of whom were coughing up hairballs on an almost daily basis. We've tried adding hairball-control Greenies to their food, as well as certain fish-flavored gels, but purchasing this food has been a complete 180! I wasn't confident it would work, but in the three-ish months since feeding our cats this food twice a day, the total hairball count has been less than 10, and the hairballs we do find are much smaller and easy to clean up. Also, the fact that this food has a lower fat content and is higher in protein is great! Our cats are looking skinnier and there are fewer hairballs. Perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Kitty Approved
customer_reviews.text: I've tried several very expensive, premium cat foods. I started with Iams, but weaned my 2 cats onto each new premium food. One of my kitties wouldn't eat as much of the expensive stuff, or they would start throwing up and one brand they wouldn't touch at all! I've had to go back to this formula of Iams and they just love it. My heavy cat has even gotten down to and been maintaining, a healthy weight since I've kept them on Iams for good now. I'm very happy with this formula.
customer_reviews.author: Danni

customer_reviews.title: Stinky!!!
customer_reviews.text: My indoor cats flopping gut has gotten much smaller! It might be because he hates the food so he eats is slower than any other food he’s had in the past. It’s super stinky and not in a “oh that’s cat food” kinda stink, it’s more of a “did I leave a rotting glass of milk somewhere around here?” Kind of stink. Not good. We will still get this because he got used to it and eats it just fine now but he really hated it at first and we moved his food bowl so we didn’t have to smell it!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jenpco

customer_reviews.title: Good enough for me.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve tried a lot of cat foods and am sticking with IAMS. It’s not expensive and may not get the credit that high priced organic holistic grain free and all those get but after trying them all and researching the pros and cons, I have found that IAMS is perfect for my two cats. This one does help reduce indoor weight problems as I had using regular high K/cal food. And the ingredients are good. They are just as healthy and have all the normalities as being on the expensive showy stuff so stick with IAMS. Most low known cat brands are junk but not IAMS; they know their stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Schuetz

customer_reviews.title: My cats do not like this
customer_reviews.text: Both of my cats do not care for this at all. We have watched them actually take pieces into their mouth and spit them out to the side of the dish. They do this mostly with the darker pieces and it makes a mess. Even after they eat whatever they do eat, I find piles of it spewed all over the house. I am not sure why this food is causing this reaction since they have eaten other kinds of Iams products in the past. This is the first time we have seen this behavior.
customer_reviews.author: GC

customer_reviews.title: I'm still buy it
customer_reviews.text: our cat like it i had a black cat that I fed her this product and her coat was so shining that one time when we took her to the vet to get her shots she stood out and everyone made a comment about how healthy and shine her coat was but with my current cat she's gray and medium length hair and I don't see the shine it could be because of her color but I can't tell.
customer_reviews.author: Shushu

customer_reviews.title: GREAT CAT FOOD
customer_reviews.text: I wouldn't feed my cats anything else. I had a Siamese cat that was on this for 19 years of her life. If she can live that long on Iams then I will continue to use it on my other 2 cats. I use the indoor hairball and my cats only have hairballs about once or twice a month. One is a long hair gray pursian.
customer_reviews.author: Daily Shopper

customer_reviews.title: My cat loves this food!
customer_reviews.text: This food has definitely helped my indoor cat shed almost 2 lbs in about 3 months. He was a barn cat when I adopted him and he was free fed initially. He out on 2lbs in 1 month! So I’ve tied a few different foods to help him lose the weight and this has finally done the trick. He’s not a picky eater about his food though so that helps! Also hairballs have never been a problem for him but they haven’t become one either! I’d recommend for any indoor cat who may need to shed some weight. I feed my cat 1/4 cup of this food 2x a day per my ver’s recommendation.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Happy cat
customer_reviews.text: our cat prefers this to almost anything else we've tried, and generally prefers it to people food, other than maybe Tuna. But hey, Tuna = crack, so what are you gonna do.... Our cat is a little compulsive / habit driven, and seems to "run to eat" a little bit (we leave food out continuously). This seems to work fine to prevent obesity, at least for our cat. A few nibbles and she's usually done (and happy).
customer_reviews.author: J. Spurlock

customer_reviews.title: Defective food.  I need to return this somehow.
customer_reviews.text: I want to give it zero stars. Something is wrong with the bag I received. This is the same brand and type I have used for a year. All of sudden I give my cat food from this new bag and she refuses to eat. After 2 days I realized it's the food not my cat who LOVES eating. Bought a new bag sane brand and type... problem solved. This food is defective.
customer_reviews.author: Tricia Hague

customer_reviews.title: Iams Proactive indoor hairball formula
customer_reviews.text: I have 5 finicky felines. I used to feed Purina cat chow Since I switched their food to Iams Proactive I see a major difference in their coat. Also they seem to have less hairballs and are more active. All are inside cats that never go outside. I highly recommend. It is 22 pound bag for around $29. This food is for indoor cats and promotes healthy weight and minimizes hairballs. The kibbles are small and digested easily. Also I was concerned with the amount of waste produced. I must say with 5 cats the waste is minimal. I am impressed
customer_reviews.author: Karin Wasserman

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t smell bad. Vet said good brand
customer_reviews.text: My cats are not over weight (one cat does need to loose 1.5lbs but at least he hasn’t gained more on this) and they NEVER have hair balls. Only my long haired cat has only had ONE hair ball. Which that is just Incredible. No stomach issues with this either. Doesn’t smell bad. Vet said good brand, but I should add wet food to their diet as well so they can better stay hydrated and keeps kidneys healthy. This will also help them to intake less carbohydrates since dry food has more of it. Either one meal dry and one meal wet or just mix some wet food with the dry. Haven’t done that yet though.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Lentz

customer_reviews.title: Cats like it
customer_reviews.text: My Cats like this food and we give it to our cats that are both outside and inside cats. We still get an occasional hairball from the one that is extremely hairy, but nothing like we did when we used other food. I give the bag a 1, they changed it from the heavy paper bag to a plastic one. The plastic is very hard to open and even harder to pour out of. I transfer the food to a smaller container that I store with the food dish and the older bags was very easy to pour and fill the container. With the newer plastic ones I am always spilling food out and having to clean up.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Y.

customer_reviews.title: A good staple dry food
customer_reviews.text: If yours are half as squirrelly as our three cats, you know how much of a pain hairball medicine is. This food easily reduced how often we treat hairballs by 80%, with only the rare dry cough (followed by hairball relief paste for the next two days) once every month or two during spring/fall. It's also stopped our more food-driven one from gaining more weight and gives all three plenty of playful energy. I still recommend the occasional wet food, but this does just fine on its own.
customer_reviews.author: Ari Berry

customer_reviews.title: Cats Not Fans
customer_reviews.text: My four cats are not big fans of IAMS Proactive Hairball dry food. They will eat it reluctantly if there are no other options, but often it just sits there. It may be healthy and may help with hairballs, but if my cats won't eat it, then none of that matters. When they do eat because there are not other options, they may get a bit surly, but hairballs do seem to diminish in frequency. ~ Kort
customer_reviews.author: Kort

customer_reviews.title: I love the convenience of ordering this product through Amazon
customer_reviews.text: I love the convenience of ordering this product through Amazon. I don't have to travel 30+ miles to get it now. My kitties were all considered overweight and they have all lost considerable weight with this cat food. Weight loss so far ranges from 5 pounds to 8 pounds, which for a cat is a lot! The bonus is the amount of hairballs has been significantly reduced as well.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa M.

customer_reviews.title: Great value on a good cat food
customer_reviews.text: Our one-eared tuxedo cat, Vinnie Vangogo isn't a picky eater and she is a grazer. But she's also extremely lazy and started looking a little, blob-like. Our vet suggested cutting back her food. Suddenly she started bingeing and getting sick. We gave our cat an eating disorder! Noooooo! So, we switched her to this to reduce some of her calories and we're still able to give her the same amount of food. She is back to grazing and who knows if she's losing weight, she's happy and we don't have to withhold food from our fur baby. :)
customer_reviews.author: MaleasPottery

customer_reviews.title: I recommended the regular food, but I have one fat cat
customer_reviews.text: He get this mixed in with the regular food in the orange bag to keep his weight and hairballs down. The other cats also go for this if they happen to be in the area when I feed him. Does it completely eliminate hairballs? No, but there are fewer. Does it help keep the cat's weight down. Yes. Do I recommend? Yes. If you don't want to or can't spend for the super premium brands this is your bag.
customer_reviews.author: jammer2099

customer_reviews.title: Cats Refuse To Eat This
customer_reviews.text: What else can I say? The cats refuse to eat anything Iams. Maybe it’s the hardness of the food, maybe the lack of a strong smell. No clue. But I just wasted money on something they won’t even touch.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best food out there
customer_reviews.text: I've had my cats on IAMS as long as I can remember. Weight and hairball care will not help your cat lose weight alone. Just like in humans, cats also need exercise and portion control. However, for a cat with a seemingly bottomless stomach, my cat seems to love this stuff, without feeling too hungry in between meals. IAMS is also always great on their coats. Within a month of starting my latest baby on IAMS, her coat was significantly thicker and longer than it was fresh out of the shelter.
customer_reviews.author: Heather W.

customer_reviews.title: not happy with new formula
customer_reviews.text: I had to throw half of this bag of cat food away since IAMS changed the (new) formula. Three of my cat started shedding like crazy. Never had this problem before, and the problem stopped after 2 weeks of NOT feeding this to my cats any more. It is sad, because they liked it and we did not have the massive shedding problem until the "new" formula.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne P.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect transition from Iams kitten food!
customer_reviews.text: If you have a finicky kitten you'll understand how hard it is to get them to switch to something with less fat and calories and it normally takes a month or more to gradually switch them over. This took less than a week. Gradually swapping the ratios of Iams kitten food/Adult food we noticed that after just 4 days kitty was just eating the adult part of the mixed food and skipping the kitten part altogether. Great job Iams!
customer_reviews.author: Lorraine Quesada

customer_reviews.title: Recipe change ruined this
customer_reviews.text: The old recipe was perfect but for last 6 months one of my 4 cats vomits every time she eats it. I see from several other reviews it must be the recipe change last year. I changed to the pink bag of iams sensitive digestion and no more vomiting. I don't know why they changed the formula but i would like it them to go back.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I got this so my cats would have fewer hair ...
customer_reviews.text: I got this so my cats would have fewer hair balls. However, now my cats throw this food up daily. I am going to have to abandon this cat food. Unfortunately, I purchased the giant 22 lb bag.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Helps with Hairballs
customer_reviews.text: With 6 cats (Yeah, I know, I know.), I needed SOMETHING to help with hairballs on BRAND NEW HARDWOOD floors. My cats range in age from 17 to 4 and from 6 pounds to 23 pounds. My super chonk sheds like mad too. So does my old girl. My old girl's energy is way up (Someone explain to her that she is NOT a kitten.) and hairballs are way down. I do wish that it controlled weight better. It is impossible to keep the super chonk separate.
customer_reviews.author: Laura M.

customer_reviews.title: Solid Cat Food
customer_reviews.text: Good value with regular subscribe and save shipping. Cats accept the flavor and vet says they're in good health for being 8 years old. Only complaint in the way the subscribe and save is fulfilled. I have it set to deliver this product on certain dates every so many weeks, but more often than not I'll receive this and my dog's food early--as much as two weeks earlier than the subscribe and save schedule.I'd rather have it arrive early than late, but the large package is quite inconvenient to have to keep around until my kibble sealed storage bin is actually empty and ready for the new bag.
customer_reviews.author: kersto19

customer_reviews.title: My cats stools are back to where they should be
customer_reviews.text: I had use this product before but decided to change to something a little less expensive Purina. But I didn't notice litter box problems so to speak the cats weren't having their same healthy box habits. So I went back to this and almost immediately your stools were back to normal and not all dried out my cats have their energy back. Very glad I did decide to come back it is definitely cast from my cats even if it is just a little more money
customer_reviews.author: Carol Gray

customer_reviews.title: Cat started vomiting even more
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to heal hairballs vomiting, but after introducing this my cat started to vomit even more often. All negative reviews are about changing formula and many cats are getting sick. When this cheating and abuse will stop with those deceiving overall number of reviews for the different product?
customer_reviews.author: freeb****

customer_reviews.title: I'm not a cat but...
customer_reviews.text: Well I am not a cat so I cant tell you what it taste like, but my cat seems to like it. I dont mind the smell, it doesn't bother me at all..again I am not a cat...Now the $ part I can get in on. I pay just about the same price for it at Walmart or the grocery store so having it delivered to my door a serious plus!
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Pope

customer_reviews.title: Cats ate too much
customer_reviews.text: Our cats liked the food, however they ate so much of this food with the weight loss formula and would cry and cry for more food. We were going through bags really quick and they were not really losing much weight. We switched to the IAMs proactive health regular and they stopped crying between feedings and are all healthy weights (except my one chubby girl but she get's people food because she is sneaky/cute/daddies little angel).
customer_reviews.author: S. Fann

customer_reviews.title: Maybe it does help with hairballs...
customer_reviews.text: Because I've found... well, cat output, shall we say? ... in all kinds of spots in my house since I fed this to my 2 fur-friends. So I have mixed feelings on this. My cats are very sleep and don't really need weight control (yet). If I keep being good to them with treats and such, maybe they will need to go on a diet, though!!
customer_reviews.author: LittleTank

customer_reviews.title: Poison?
customer_reviews.text: My pets are all getting sick from this and even the dog is not getting into it. I finished up some food ahead before using it and I have missed my return wondow now.
customer_reviews.author: Mindygouv

customer_reviews.title: Our indoor cat likes it
customer_reviews.text: We have a 5-year-old domestic shorthair. She's slightly overweight (~13lbs). She sometimes throws up when we feed her Hill's Metabolic Diet, but has never had trouble with this one. With IAMS, she rarely have hairball problems although she's a groomer, but losing weight is still difficult for her.
customer_reviews.author: lily

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work for my guy
customer_reviews.text: My cat did not like this food. He is twelve and this is the first time he hasn’t liked something. He is a twenty pound Maine Coon and eats like a horse. Switched him to Purina natural indoor and he’s back to himself.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My cat loves it! He got his spunk back
customer_reviews.text: My cat has been eating this for about 2 months now and I am seeing him much more playful. He's getting that kitten spunk back! He's not over eating anymore but he loves his food. I didn't know that I was purchasing a weight management food I just saw it was indoor and he loves the indoor verity in the other brands so I switched. I was planning on just ordering regular iams for him instead but then he started to feel so spunky I knew I should keep with it.
customer_reviews.author: mary

customer_reviews.title: Ha! They think it's treats.
customer_reviews.text: We have a kitty with special food needs and my fat cat has been getting jealous so I picked this up for her and the other fosters. So when special boy gets his special food, I put this out. Everyone thinks they're getting spoiled, but they're actually eating better! It smells great and they seem to love it. You can't beat the price!
customer_reviews.author: K Household

customer_reviews.title: This product has really helped my cats
customer_reviews.text: I changed to Iams because my cats had a skin issue that I thought might be due to reactions from something in the food that I was using. The cats do not eat as much of this food as it seems to meet their nutritional needs. The cats skin problem vanish and so did the amount of vomiting. The vomiting decreased to almost nothing. Another bonusof this food isif its vomited back up, it does not stain the carpet like other pet foods did.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to open the bag neatly, and it's not resealable
customer_reviews.text: Cat seems to like it, so I bought the big bag, was instructing daughter to keep it closed tight to keep it fresh, and I noticed the bag had no perforation to open nor any way to reseal it. I am new to cats. The dog food brands I've always bought (prob not IAMS) had resealable bags. Not impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Schaps

customer_reviews.title: no my choice of cat food
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for a shelter that had it on its wish list. Based on the ingredients I would not feed this to my cat. I prefer a food that has higher quality meat proteins and no corn.
customer_reviews.author: Raoul Duke online shopperTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: My 4 cats love it!
customer_reviews.text: We've been using Iams for several years. Our cats all come running when I shake the container I keep it in. It's crunchy and small so even my elderly cat can enjoy it (sometimes the dog sneeks a bite too). It does not have a strong odor; keeps crunchy even when used in an automatic feeder. I highly recommend for your cats.
customer_reviews.author: Lea A Foster

customer_reviews.title: Great big bag of food
customer_reviews.text: My Cat loves this kibble. Based on my research, it's just as good if not a little better than the other kibble on the market. This is her primary source of food. She likes the crunch and I think it is good for her dental health to have some crunch in her diet. The bag is genuine and I'm very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Carlo Costanzo

customer_reviews.title: Healthier Cats
customer_reviews.text: My cats were getting fat (they are older and are indoor-outdoor) and they were barfing a lot. I was using an expensive brand for touchy stomachs and it just wasn't working. I changed to the Iams a month ago and have had great results. The cats like it, and they have lost a little weight and are more active. They also are not barfing at all. I'm very pleased. It doesn't cost as much as the brand I was previously using either.
customer_reviews.author: pamelapiep

customer_reviews.title: My fat cat likes it.
customer_reviews.text: My cat has put on quite a bit of weight so knowing how much she loves IAMS foods, I got this one to try to help her lose some weight. She really likes it.
customer_reviews.author: A. Farley

customer_reviews.title: Did not get what I ordered
customer_reviews.text: I've had trouble finding Iam's indoor chicken dry food in the stores so i ordered online. I received chicken, turkey and greens instead of just the chicken formula. My cats are very sensitive to foods and the chicken formula has worked well for them for years. The chicken, turkey and greens mix causes them to throw up alot.
customer_reviews.author: Meeemow

customer_reviews.title: 10/10 would recommend!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my new baby that I got from the shelter. He was eating Cat Chow there, but wanted something a bit better for him. I know you're supposed to mix new food with old first, but I gave it a go with straight Iams anyway to see how he'd do. He loves it and we have had any issues! Even the picky neighbor's cat who visits likes it! Quite happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jewelieta

customer_reviews.title: good for sensitive stomach!!!
customer_reviews.text: A bit high price but works good on my cats sensitive stomach!! was throwing up alot with other cat food!! switch to a little more expensive cat food and no issues!!!!just a little concerned it a diet cat food!!! but if hes that hungry, he will just eat more!!! Will keep an eye open for weight loss!!!
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia

customer_reviews.title: Idk, my cat had asthma not fur balls
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure yet. He's an indoor outdoor cat so I mix it in with other dry food. I don't think after a month or 2 that it's really helped. I'm adding fish oil, and about 1/3 of a tiny can of fish type food. He might need to go to the vet. Hoping the fish oil will do it. Update. Found out he has asthma! Was not fur balls he was coughing due to asthma.
customer_reviews.author: lulu

customer_reviews.title: Quality food for a reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: With three cats, we were constantly buying cat food. And, as we have used IAMS their entire lives, our 13 year old cat will only eat her dry food. As she began having issues with hair balls, we switched from the original to this. It has worked wonderfully for her - she is doing much better. And, our local stores have stopped carrying the larger bags so this is a win win for us - less frequent trips for food and a healthier cat!
customer_reviews.author: Kathy M

customer_reviews.title: Iam's weight control cat food
customer_reviews.text: Cat isn't a bit happy with this food but needs it so I will mix it with the food she prefers until I can get her used to eating it.
customer_reviews.author: KathyBEE

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: A very good way to feed your cat without me worry of weight gain. My cats love this dry food so very much that when I ran out and had to replace it with a different dry food I borrowed from a neighbor they refused to eat the borrowed and spend a solid 24 hours not speaking to me or allowing me to pet them. True fact.
customer_reviews.author: Vickie Ann

customer_reviews.title: Yummy for my cats. I thought the indoor label ...
customer_reviews.text: Yummy for my cats. I thought the indoor label meant that my cats would maintain a lower weight (due to lower fat content) but my tabby appears to have picked up a few pounds. I do feel obligated to mention that all she does is sleep all day so that may be it, too.
customer_reviews.author: PKING

customer_reviews.title: Really effective in helping my cat's horrible eating habits/fat trajectory
customer_reviews.text: First cat I owned with an eating disorder, who was constantly hungry, getting fat, and, if he didn't get to eat constantly, when he did eat gobbled everything down and then threw it up. I bought this and gave it a go. Wow. Really worked. He eats a little bit and that fills him up, he is content. He has lost weight, slimming down nicely. Seems much calmer too. Well done IAMS.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for sensitive cats
customer_reviews.text: I have two manx cats who have very sensitive stomachs. Other cat foods (even natural and vet recommended) would cause my one manx to bleed... (eeek!) I picked this up on suggestion from a vet tech one day and my little guys haven't had stomach issues sense. No hairball issues, no random vomit anywhere, and no bleeding. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just like any cat food, your cat may or may not like it
customer_reviews.text: I honestly don't know why they're asking me what it taste like or what the scent is like, because it's dry cat food. It smells like dry cat food. And I'm not going to taste it. My cat will not eat it by itself. I have to mix it with another dry cat food and she won't eat the other one by itself either. She'll only the two mixed together. So I get the other one from here also.
customer_reviews.author: Carmel Gangi

customer_reviews.title: Made cats sick
customer_reviews.text: Made our cats have stunk scented urine and stool an now they won’t touch it. We usually buy Iams at the store, this must have been an old bag. Even the dog won’t touch it. Scary!
customer_reviews.author: Nurse Lorlor

customer_reviews.title: Cat hates
customer_reviews.text: I think good price for the size but, poor cat just hates it. I started giving her about a third of short can every few days and leave the dry until she eats it. I have never seen a hairball so I guess this does the trick. This is my first totally indoor cat.
customer_reviews.author: Hotshotmom13

customer_reviews.title: Recommend
customer_reviews.text: I've tried other cat foods but this is the only brand that doesn't cause Thomas to throw up, even Purina that I purchased by mistake thinking it was Iams, same size bag even the color of bag was the same. I fed it to him but the above problems happened, so I immediately put him back on Iams. I haven't tried the other Iams selections and may not bc of this working so well for him.
customer_reviews.author: Pat Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Cat pick
customer_reviews.text: My cat has been puking this up for 3 days,I am stopping giving it to her...she has never puked like this ....poor cat...if she stops puking it's the food...it is the food
customer_reviews.author: Carol moore

customer_reviews.title: My cats seem to like it
customer_reviews.text: I've been feeding this to my cats since my vet said the grocery store stuff is like feeding your animals McDonald's every day - but I didn't want to do the Science Diet stuff. This seems to work well as I have indoor cats. One does go out during the day, but he's a bit overweight so this helps him keep his weight down.
customer_reviews.author: Marsha Byrne

customer_reviews.title: Big-Snuggles, Krazy-Whyte & Scratchy-ScratchOff give three MEOW. MEOW MEOW's.
customer_reviews.text: First time purchasing this iams brand hard cat food. Always buy the hill's science one. My darlings took to it right away and that made momma very very happy. The price was excellent and the bits are just the right size. Happy I decided to purchase it and will again.
customer_reviews.author: Ida Grant

customer_reviews.title: Will stay with this brand and formula exclusively
customer_reviews.text: Best cat good out there. A little pricier but when you follow feeding guidelines lasts longer than a bigger cheap brand and bonus that pays for itself is that my cats finally stopped throwing up! I bought purina a couple weeks ago because my store was out of IAMS. Now we are just playing the game of waiting out the vomiting till the IAMS kicks back in. Now I have it on auto-ship from Amazon to avoid that problem again!
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: My Cat Gets Sick With Each New Bag
customer_reviews.text: I've been feeding my pets Iams for years with no issues. I had this product delivered on a subscription to make it easier for me to purchase, but I've cancelled because the last two times I ordered, one of my cats started throwing up the food. Each time was right after I opened a new bag. The first time, I didn't think much of it other than she had gotten sick. Then the following month, I opened the new bag, and she threw up her dinner again. I don't know why we're having problems with the delivered food but I'm discontinuing the use of online-ordered cat food.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Kelley

customer_reviews.title: Cat vomiting from this!!
customer_reviews.text: My cat vomited all day and has diarrhea from this formula. It’s suppose to be chicken only but it says chicken-turkey. I think there is something wrong with this food.
customer_reviews.author: mary mcnally

customer_reviews.title: Not the right product. Cats were not happy.
customer_reviews.text: Gave my cats the worst smelling poop and dark stools. Never again. This must be a bad bag or something because they eat this regularly. Never ordering this item from here again.
customer_reviews.author: JMadison

customer_reviews.title: Bag had two cuts in it when I opened it ...
customer_reviews.text: Bag had two cuts in it when I opened it and food had leaked out in to outer box we were out of cat food so checked it over didn’t really notice anything untoward so went ahead and used it . Not ideal but needs must
customer_reviews.author: sarah

customer_reviews.title: ... three of them actually eat this food which is amazing. This product was recommended to me by my ...
customer_reviews.text: I have three cats and all three of them actually eat this food which is amazing. This product was recommended to me by my vet several years ago and I've used it ever since. It does a great job of maintaining my indoor cat's weight; however, we still deal with lots of hairballs in all three cats (1 long hair and 2 short hairs).
customer_reviews.author: New Horizons

customer_reviews.title: THE BEST FOR INDOOR CATS
customer_reviews.text: I'LL SAY IT FLAT OUT ! I'VE TRIED OTHER CHEAPER DRY CAT FOOD FOR INDOOR KITTIES AND THEIR POO REALLY STUNK !! FOR WHATEVER REASON IT DOESN'T SMELL WITH THIS AND HIS KITTY BOX IS FAIRLY CLOSE TO MY MAIN DESK AREA...........HIGHLY RECOMMEND IT !
customer_reviews.author: susan o.

customer_reviews.title: Cat loves it
customer_reviews.text: I adopted my calico at 5 weeks from the Humane Society but now she's 12 and her food wasn't settling as well. Once I switched to this dry food she never threw up even with her long coat. I swear by this and anything that makes her healthy and happy gets two paws up.
customer_reviews.author: CaliGal

customer_reviews.title: Soft, Shiny Coat; Healthy, Happy Cats
customer_reviews.text: I have fed Iams to my cat his whole life. He will be 13 this summer & he hasn’t been sick a day in his life. He has the energy & playfulness of a much younger cat & his coat is unbelievably soft! I confidently, highly recommend feeding Iams to your pets!
customer_reviews.author: Kristen SW Washington

customer_reviews.title: Cat says yum.
customer_reviews.text: Compared to the other cat food my cat would eat, this scent is not as potent. Also, I spent more money on the old cat food and it was smaller than this bag of food. My cat seems to enjoy it, as she always wants to eat. She has not had any vomiting issues or other problems that were mentioned in some reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: 👍🏻
customer_reviews.text: Cat loves this brand and flavor; really helps with hairballs; delivered in the time promised.
customer_reviews.author: Lunamer

customer_reviews.title: Ms. Kitty didn't like it
customer_reviews.text: Our cat went three days and did not eat any of this. She smelled it and did not like it at all. I gave it to the shelter for their cats.
customer_reviews.author: Sue

customer_reviews.title: Cat Loves It and Keeps Her Healthy
customer_reviews.text: While I haven't tasted it myself, my cat seems to enjoy this food considerably more than other offerings. It's also helped her maintain a healthy weight and keeps the hairballs to a minimum so I'd call it a win. Never buying another food again.
customer_reviews.author: Zack Hensley

customer_reviews.title: Great food and price
customer_reviews.text: My cat seems to be losing weight. Iams is a brand I trust and not to expensive. Chicken meal is better then lean chicken because it more closely resembles a felines natural diet with all the chicken parts. Don't be fooled by the come latelies I have had a sick cat from a come lately high protein cat food.
customer_reviews.author: Big Jon

customer_reviews.title: Cat is obsessed
customer_reviews.text: My cat literally lives for this food. When she’s not sleeping, she waits by her dish until it’s time to get fed. I tried buying a cheaper brand but that didn’t work out well. She didn’t eat it the whole 3 days I had it out for her. THIS she loves. She even cuddles us every morning when she asks for this food.
customer_reviews.author: Celeste

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Picture on bag shoes chicken. Actual flavor when I got it is chicken turkey and garden vegetables which I have never even heard of. My cat is not picky but he won’t touch this food and neither will either if my daughters’cats. Will have to toss the whole bag and buy the chicken flavor at the store. Don’t waste your money
customer_reviews.author: Janice Wheelbarger

customer_reviews.title: Cured my cat’s bulimia.
customer_reviews.text: When she was about seven she started throwing up pretty regularly. Not just the occasional hairball, this was becoming a weekly if not daily occurrence. I tried all kinds of foods and supplements. Nothing worked until I switched her to this Iams formula. She’s ten now and doing great.
customer_reviews.author: DD

customer_reviews.title: possible defective
customer_reviews.text: I have been buying this food for about 18 months with no problems. The last bag I bought made both my cats sick. they were losing weight and throwing up. I changed their food and they immediately started getting better; their fur is coming back in, they have stopped throwing up and are back up to normal weight.
customer_reviews.author: Lindia Moore

customer_reviews.title: Not natural,  organic and a large portion is animal by-products
customer_reviews.text: All of the nutrients and vitamins is are cooked out because of the extremely high drying that needs the product to good shelf life and create mass volume at high temperatures. I sat with my vet for almost two hours and she highly recommends Science Diet. I would accept a gift card for a really reasonable amount and donate the food gladly, or send the unused portion back to you.
customer_reviews.author: D. Barnes

customer_reviews.title: My go to food for my clan
customer_reviews.text: I have 10 cats and this food is a good enough quality for someone who has to be cost conscious yet will not buy just cat chow. My cats shed less on this and their coats are healthy. No digestive issues unless they gorge which some do at times.
customer_reviews.author: tbear

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: My cats liked it. I don't think my cats have a preference really. The review asks for a star rating on flavor, but I didnt try the cat food so I'm not sure what its entirely asking there. Lol. But my cats had no problem with the food.
customer_reviews.author: RJ

customer_reviews.title: You have a
customer_reviews.text: It's Iams cat food. I have followed the directions on the back and my cat has been consistently losing weight since I switched to this formula. She is particularly lazy, so I am pleased with the food. The weight loss has been quite subtle, but she is now closer to ten pounds instead of the twelve and growing she was doing six months ago.
customer_reviews.author: AlyAmazonBo

customer_reviews.title: Zero quality
customer_reviews.text: Gives the cats hard stools and constipation will never ever never ever buy this again. I feed it to the pigeons now
customer_reviews.author: Maurice

product_meta.title: IAMS Proactive Health Adult Indoor Weight & Hairball Control Dry Cat Food
product_meta.description: Flavor Name:Chicken| Size:7 lb.Keep your cats at their best with IAMS Proactive Health Adult Indoor Weight & Hairball Care Dry Cat Food with Chicken & Turkey—a chicken-first recipe designed to help reduce hairballs before they start, and to help your indoor cat maintain a healthy weight. Formulated with l-carnitine to help your overweight cat slowly and healthily shed extra weight, this cat kibble is made from high quality proteins like chicken and turkey (chicken is the #1 ingredient) to support your cat’s healthy diet and weight-loss regimen. Plus, with its tailored fiber blend (featuring prebiotics and beet pulp) to help support healthy digestion, it might just be the hairball care your cat needs. If you’re looking for a hairball care cat food that will also help you with your cat’s weight management, get your paws on this—and keep your cat happy, healthy, and ready to pounce with IAMS Indoor Weight & Hairball Care Dry Cat Food. If you have a kitten, pregnant or nursing cat, we recommend feeding IAMS kitten food. Remember to have clean, fresh water available for your cat at all times.
feature_bullets: Contains (1) 7 pounds bag of IAMS Proactive Health Adult Indoor Weight & Hairball Care Dry Cat Food with Chicken & Turkey
Chicken is the #1 ingredient in this protein rich cat food to help support strong muscles and to provide healthy energy for play
Formulated with l-carnitine to help your indoor cat lose weight or maintain a healthy weight
Proprietary fiber blend with beet pulp helps reduce hairballs before they start making this the perfect indoor cat food for hairball care
Part of a balanced weight control diet, and an integral component of any basic hairball care for cats
10 % less fat compared to IAMS Healthy Adult Original with Chicken, so your cat can enjoy a high quality protein meal
